name: Vip
body:
### Week 1
- Get familiar with D3JS
- Project Goal
Author your page content here [using GitHub Flavored Markdown](https://guides.github.com/features/mastering-markdown/)

### Week 2
- Read code from last semester and summer
- Understand pros and cons of the past project 
- Take one of the input data sets in csv format and print a table

### Week 3
- Continued last weeks task
- Set up IIS server on the Windows machine to be able to upload host website and use localhost
- Apache server on Linux for convenience
- Set up a Github repository 

### Week 4
- Use the same csv from the past 2 weeks and make a bar chart in d3js
- Make search function to take input of specific ID and extract its crime information
- The ID being compared should go to the bottom of the stack for easy comparison

### Week 5
- Host the website on [Purdue server](http://web.ics.purdue.edu/~awairaga/)
- Host the weekly blog and the website on [Github](http://apoorvvw.github.io/VIP)
- Practice D3JS and continue last times task

### Week 6
- Make a Stacked Bar chart from the same csv file

### Week 7
- Search
- [Autocomplete Search](jqueryui.com/autocomplete/#remote)
- And group the crimes maybe - [ColorBrewer2](http://colorbrewer2.org/) chose 2 sets of 11
- Textbox to have a value of the y axis - [Link](https://gist.github.com/phoebebright/3098488)

### Week 8
- Sort and push to the bottom most 
- Async = false;  // call ----- Document ready funtion
- Use ajax call to load the data ( Email )
- GET CURSOR location for changing the y axis whn clicked on a particular coulmn
- [Link for AutoComplete](jqueryui.com/autocomplete/#remote)    <!-- copy code -->
- Comma seperated search for multiple ids
- Defualt y axis limit when data is null
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
